results.title: Elie Wiesel's Jerusalem
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns and John McGreevy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
American author Elie Wiesel takes the viewer on a personal pilgrimage through the legends, myths and historical sights of Jerusalem.

results.title: Jonathan Miller's London
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
Dr Jonathan Miller gives his personal view of the historical development of the city of London including his own personal upbringing in that city.

results.title: Hildegard Knef's Berlin
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns International and John McGreevy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
Hildegard Knef opens Berlin to the viewers of this film in an extensively historical yet highly personal manner. She introduces us to her personal family history and to the ramifications of Nazi power. The tour also includes historical footage of the “formidable women who cleaned up the rubble of demolished Berlin” after World War II, of John Kennedy’s famous speech declaring his Berlin citizenship, of the 15-foot-high concrete barricade that divides the city, and of the airlift that kept the city of two million people totally supplied.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns International and John McGreevy Productions

results.title: Melina Mercouri's Athens
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
The vivacity of Melina Mercouri - singer, actress and parliamentarian, shines through as she reveals Athens as “a city with ancient ruins but with a heart that beats stronger than ever before”.

results.title: Germaine Greer's Sydney
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns International and John McGreevy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
A look at Sydney with Germaine Greer. She comments on it being a city “where the poorest people can be millionaires. Where, for practically nothing, you can do the same things that in other countries you have to join select clubs to do.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns International and John McGreevy Productions

results.title: Peter Ustinov's Leningrad
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns and John McGreevy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
Presents Peter Ustinov’s personal view of Leningrad. He briefly relates the city’s history, showing many of the buildings - St. Peter and St. Paul Cathedral, the Imperial Winter Palace, St. Isaac’s Cathedral, amongst many others. He discusses many aspects of the arts, literature, music ballet and drama of Leningrad.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns and John McGreevy Productions

results.title: Citizen Air Force
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
Shows how ex-RAAF service men and women spend their spare time in the Citizen Air Force. Photography by Geoff Thompson.
